We first test DOSFL on 10 and 100 client Federated MNIST with different combinations of soft labels, soft resets, and random masking.
All federated MNIST experiments use LeNet as the model architecture [15].
Our distilled data are not single examples but batches with size Bd=10subscriptğµğ‘‘10B_{d}=10.
Within each batch, the labels are initialized to one of each class, e.g. one label is â€˜1â€™, one label is â€˜2â€™, etc.
Using soft labels, Bdsubscriptğµğ‘‘B_{d} could be made much smaller without loss of performance.
After the server model has trained on distilled data from the clients, its accuracy is measured on a test set.
Each experiment is run 555 times, and the best result is reported in TableÂ 1.

The results, best out of 5 runs, are provided in TableÂ 2.
We also provide the accuracy of non-IID FedAvg after an equivalent amount of communication.
This allows DOSFL and FedAvg to be compared in an equal communication cost setting.
We tuned the FedAvg hyperparameters to maximize initial learning: local epochs E=5ğ¸5E=5, batch size B=10ğµ10B=10, and learning rate Î·=0.01ğœ‚0.01\eta=0.01.
The batch size was the lowest in the considered range {10,20,50,100,200,500}102050100200500\{10,20,50,100,200,500\} and the learning rate the largest in {10âˆ’2,3Ã—10âˆ’3,10âˆ’3,3Ã—10âˆ’4,10âˆ’4}superscript1023superscript103superscript1033superscript104superscript104\{10^{-2},3\times 10^{-3},10^{-3},3\times 10^{-4},10^{-4}\}.
Note that, the preserved accuracy, defined as the DOSFL accuracy over baseline performance, of all tasks is at least 93%percent9393\%.
This shows that DOSFL is capable of handling different tasks with small or large datasets in one round.

Note that this value is independent of the number of clients Nğ‘N.
Break even rounds for federated MNIST, IMDB, TREC-6, and Sent140 are provided in TableÂ 3 along with the data and model size.
We also investigate potential communication savings when using larger models, such as Transformers, for Sent140.
The higher break even round for MNIST, compared to the text tasks, is due to LeNet having significantly fewer parameters than either TextCNN or Bi-LSTM.
The best accuracy at the break even round Tbâ€‹râ€‹eâ€‹aâ€‹kâ€‹eâ€‹vâ€‹eâ€‹nsubscriptğ‘‡ğ‘ğ‘Ÿğ‘’ğ‘ğ‘˜ğ‘’ğ‘£ğ‘’ğ‘›T_{break\ even} is reported in TableÂ 2.

We choose the smallest iso-accuracy round Tiâ€‹sâ€‹oâ€‹aâ€‹câ€‹câ€‹uâ€‹râ€‹aâ€‹câ€‹ysubscriptğ‘‡ğ‘–ğ‘ ğ‘œğ‘ğ‘ğ‘ğ‘¢ğ‘Ÿğ‘ğ‘ğ‘¦T_{iso\ accuracy} out of 5 trials.
The values for both quantities is shown in TableÂ 4.
For some tasks, FedAvg fails to converge due to having only 1 client update the gradient each round.
In general, DOSFL saves more communication when the size of the model increases or when the dataset becomes more challenging.
Besides MNIST, communication savings are up to 3 orders of magnitude.
